meanings.definition: Midrashim - plural noun: Jewish commentaries and interpretations of the Bible.
meanings.sent1: The scholars studied the midrashim to gain insights into the ancient texts.
meanings.sent2: The rabbi shared some midrashim during the religious service.
meanings.sent3: The children found the midrashim fascinating and asked many questions.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of the Bible deepened after reading the midrashim.
meanings.sent5: The midrashim shed light on the meaning behind the biblical stories.

meanings.definition: Midrashim - verb: to interpret or explain biblical texts in a creative or imaginative way.
meanings.sent1: She loved to midrashim the stories from the Torah to her friends.
meanings.sent2: The teacher encouraged the students to midrashim the parables in their own words.
meanings.sent3: He would often midrashim the scriptures with a humorous twist.
meanings.sent4: The author's ability to midrashim the ancient texts was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: They would gather to midrashim the Bible passages under the starry sky.
